targets.query: SELECT mean("warning") FROM "cluster_faults" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("warning") FROM "cluster_faults" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("warning") FROM "cluster_faults" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("warning") FROM "cluster_faults" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("active_sessions") FROM "cluster_capacity" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("cpu") FROM "node_stats" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("storage_efficiency") FROM "volume_efficiency" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "id"::tag fill(null)
SELECT mean("storage_efficiency") FROM "volume_efficiency" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "id"::tag fill(null)

panels.title: iSCSI connections - time since last SCSI command

panels.description: Red color represents idling below MinIOPS. Green means very little idling below MinIOPS.
panels.title: Volume QoS histograms - write block sizes

panels.description: Red color represents idling below MinIOPS. Green means very little idling below MinIOPS.
panels.title: Volume QoS histograms - read block sizes

panels.description: Ideally, most bars should appear in the bottom half of this chart, indicating that the volume is spending less than 50% of time *not* using more than MinIOPS value.
panels.title: Volume QoS Histogram - % time below MinIOPS

targets.query: SELECT mean("average_io_size"), mean("actual_iops") FROM "volume_performance" WHERE ("id"::tag = '134') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "name"::tag fill(null)

panels.title: Volume performance - average IO size and actual IOPS (vid: 134)

targets.query: SELECT mean("average_io_size") FROM "volume_stats" WHERE ("id"::tag = '134' OR "id"::tag = '135') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "name"::tag fill(null)
SELECT mean("average_io_size") FROM "volume_stats" WHERE ("id"::tag = '134' OR "id"::tag = '135') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "name"::tag fill(null)

panels.title: Volume performance - zero blocks as % of volume size
Volume performance - Burst IO credit in 4kB Ops

panels.description: Panel shows mode of replication for paired SolidFire volumes.
panels.title: Volume replication

panels.description: This panel assumes volume 162 has access set to replicationTarget, and monitors increase in write_bytes to capture (inbound) replication performance.

targets.query: SELECT derivative(sum("write_bytes"), 60s) FROM "volume_performance" WHERE ("id"::tag = '162') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "id"::tag

panels.title: Volume replication performance for volume ID 162
